title.narrative: Somalia Advocates for Health and Nutrition (SAHAN) Programme (including Birth Preparadeness Class Prototype)

description.narrative: Protection of Human Dignity in Humanitarian Crises: Communities affected by crisis receive timely, accountable and needs based humanitarian assistance that protects their safety, dignity and fundamental human rights.

The Somali Advocates for Health and Nutrition (SAHAN) Programme, which comprises the Demand Creation for Health Services component of DFID’s Somali Health, and Nutrition Programme (SHINE) programme will run from 2016 to 2021. Under this programme, Trocaire aims to increase access to and utilization of reproductive, nutrition, child, and maternal health services and to promote healthy behavior change. Trocaire Somalia is using an adaptive, evidence-based, participatory and human centred design to better understand the persistent barriers to uptake of health services and health- seeking behavior and develop and test innovations in demand creation that target the internal and external factors which influence individual behavior to improve the health of Somali women and children.

mailing-address.narrative: Trócaire Head Office, Maynooth, Co. Kildare, W23 NX63, Ireland,
